SYSTEM: PROLEGintro_eng_long.pdf: PÃ¡gina 46
Examples of PROLEG semantics
Example 2 Let P2 = {H2, E2} and H2 be the following set of
rules:
P <=.
Q <=.
and E2 be the following set of exceptions:
exception(P,Q).
exception(Q,P).
Let M2 = {P}. Then, since HM2 = {P <=.} and M2 = min(HM2),
M2 is an extension.
Let M3 = {Q}. Then, since HM3 = {Q <=.} and M3 = min(HM3),
M3 is also an extension.
46
speaker: SYSTEM
